meanings.definition: The quality of being faithful or loyal.
meanings.sent1: Her faithfulness to her best friend never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The dog showed great faithfulness to its owner by always staying by their side.
meanings.sent3: The faithfulness of the old clock to keep time was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The faithfulness of the compass always pointing north guided them through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The faithfulness of the sun rising every morning is a comforting constant in life.

meanings.definition: The state of being reliable or dependable.
meanings.sent1: The faithfulness of the old car never breaking down was a relief.
meanings.sent2: In a storm, the lighthouse's faithfulness in guiding ships to safety was crucial.
meanings.sent3: The faithfulness of the umbrella to keep you dry in the rain is quite handy.
meanings.sent4: The faithfulness of the map leading them through the maze was a lifesaver.
meanings.sent5: The faithfulness of the flashlight to shine in the dark helped them find their way.

meanings.definition: Consistent adherence to promises or obligations.
meanings.sent1: His faithfulness in keeping his word earned him respect.
meanings.sent2: The company's faithfulness in delivering orders on time was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The faithfulness of the alarm clock to wake you up every morning can be annoying.
meanings.sent4: The faithfulness of the river to flow steadily symbolized reliability.
meanings.sent5: The faithfulness of the gardener to tend to the plants daily ensured their growth.
